description: A comprehensive blood test to measure various health indicators, including blood cell counts, glucose levels, and more.
X-ray imaging to help diagnose various conditions by providing detailed images of bones and other internal structures.
Ultrasound imaging using high-frequency sound waves to capture live images from the inside of the body.
Electrocardiogram (EKG) test to measure the electrical activity of the heart and detect any abnormalities.
Mammogram to screen for breast cancer by taking X-ray images of the breast.
Computed Tomography (CT) scan that combines X-ray images to create cross-sectional views of the body.
Pap smear test to screen for cervical cancer by collecting cells from the cervix.
Stress test to monitor the heart's activity during physical exertion.
Lipid panel to measure cholesterol levels and assess the risk of heart disease.
Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) scan to produce detailed images of organs and tissues within the body.
Thyroid function test to evaluate the performance of the thyroid gland and diagnose related conditions.
Urinalysis to examine urine for a range of disorders, such as urinary tract infections, kidney disease, and diabetes.
